engine.math

Class BoundingBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.math.BoundingBox

  • public class BoundingBox
extends java.lang.Object
    The BoundingBox represents a rectangle in 2D space. It contains a position, width and height and various methods for moving and resizing the box, as well as some methods for checking if two BoundingBoxes have collided.
    Author:
    Michael

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BoundingBox.Side
      Side is usually used to indicate which side of a BoundingBox object has collided with another BoundingBox.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoundingBox(BoundingBox other)
      Constructs a deep copy of the argument object so that this object is an independent copy of the original with the same values for x, y, width and height.
      BoundingBox(float leftX, float topY, float width, float height)
      Constructs a BoundingBox by specifying the topleft coordinates and the width and height.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoundingBox

        public BoundingBox(float leftX,
                   float topY,
                   float width,
                   float height)
            throws MathException
        Constructs a BoundingBox by specifying the topleft coordinates and the width and height.
        Parameters:
        leftX - the x coordinate of the left side of the box.
        topY - the y coordinate of the top side of the box.
        width - the distance from left to right.
        height - the distance from top to bottom.
        Throws:
        MathException - if width or height are negative.

      • BoundingBox

        public BoundingBox(BoundingBox other)
        Constructs a deep copy of the argument object so that this object is an independent copy of the original with the same values for x, y, width and height.
        Parameters:
        other - the BoundingBox to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • getCenteredInstance

        public static BoundingBox getCenteredInstance(Vector2D center,
                                              float width,
                                              float height)
                                       throws MathException
        This returns a BoundingBox of the given width and height, centered at the given Vector2D. This means the top left will be at (center.x-width/2, center.y-height/2). The bottom right will be at (center.x+width/2, center.height+height/2).
        Parameters:
        center - the center coordinates of the new BoundingBox.
        width - the total width of the BoundingBox.
        height - the total height of the BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        a new BoundingBox with its center coordinates at the given center of the given width and height.
        Throws:
        MathException - if width or height are negative.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Vector2D point)
        Checks if the given point is between this BoundingBox's top left and bottom right coordinates.
        Parameters:
        point - the Vector2D to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given point is inside this BoundingBox.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(BoundingBox other)
        Checks to see if the given BoundingBox overlaps with this BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        other - the BoundingBox to compare with this.
        Returns:
        true if this BoundingBox contains any corner point from the other BoundingBox.

      • getIntersectedArea

        public BoundingBox getIntersectedArea(BoundingBox other)
        Finds the area that is overlapping between this object and the given BoundingBox. This rectangle is returned as a new BoundingBox. If the BoundingBoxes are not overlapping, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        other - the BoundingBox to compare
        Returns:
        a rectangle representing the intersected area or null if no intersection was found.

      • checkCollision

        public BoundingBox.Side checkCollision(BoundingBox other)
        Returns the side of this rectangle that collided with the other box WARNING - Will fail at high speeds.
        Parameters:
        other - the BoundingBox to compare.
        Returns:
        Side.RIGHT if this object's right side collided with the given BoundingBox; Side.LEFT if this object's left side collided with the given BoundingBox; Side.TOP if this object's top side collided with the given BoundingBox; Side.BOTTOM if this object's bottom side collided with the given BoundingBox.

      • getX1

        public float getX1()
        Gets the x coordinate of the top left corner of this BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        the x coordinate of the top left corner.

      • setX1

        public void setX1(float x,
                  boolean maintainSize)
           throws MathException
        Changes the x coordinate of the top left corner of this BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x coordinate of the top left.
        maintainSize - if this is true, the bottom right corner will move relative to the top left corner. If this is false, the bottom right corner will stay in its current position relative to the global origin.
        Throws:
        MathException - if maintainSize is false and the resulting BoundingBox would have a negative width.

      • getY1

        public float getY1()
        Gets the y coordinate of the top left corner of this BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate of the top left corner.

      • setY1

        public void setY1(float y,
                  boolean maintainSize)
           throws MathException
        Changes the y coordinate of the top left corner of this BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        y - the new y coordinate of the top left.
        maintainSize - if this is true, the bottom right corner will move relative to the top left corner. If this is false, the bottom right corner will stay in its current position relative to the global origin.
        Throws:
        MathException - if maintainSize is false and the resulting BoundingBox would have a negative height.

      • getX2

        public float getX2()
        Changes the x coordinate of the bottom right corner of this BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x coordinate of the bottom right.
        maintainSize - if this is true, the top left corner will move relative to the bottom right corner. If this is false, the top left corner will stay in its current position relative to the global origin.

      • setX2

        public void setX2(float x,
                  boolean maintainSize)
           throws MathException
        Changes the x coordinate of the bottom right corner of this BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x coordinate of the bottom right.
        maintainSize - if this is true, the top left corner will move relative to the bottom right corner. If this is false, the top left corner will stay in its current position relative to the global origin.
        Throws:
        MathException - if maintainSize is false and the resulting BoundingBox would have a negative width.

      • getY2

        public float getY2()
        Gets the y coordinate of the bottom right corner of this BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate of the bottom right corner.

      • setY2

        public void setY2(float y,
                  boolean maintainSize)
           throws MathException
        Changes the y coordinate of the bottom right corner of this BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        y - the new y coordinate of the bottom right.
        maintainSize - if this is true, the top left corner will move relative to the bottom right corner. If this is false, the top left corner will stay in its current position relative to the global origin.
        Throws:
        MathException - if maintainSize is false and the resulting BoundingBox would have a negative height.

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Returns the total width of the BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        the total width.

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Returns the total height of the BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        the total height.

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(float newHeight)
               throws MathException
        Changes the total height of the BoundingBox. The bottom right corner will move; its y coordinate becoming topLeft.y + newHeight.
        Parameters:
        newHeight - the new total height of the BoundingBox.
        Throws:
        MathException - if newHeight is negative.

      • setHeightCentered

        public void setHeightCentered(float newHeight)
                       throws MathException
        Changes the total height of the BoundingBox. Both the bottom right corner and top left corner will move; expanding and shrinking relative to the center of the Bounding Box.
        Parameters:
        newHeight - the new total height of the BoundingBox.
        Throws:
        MathException - if the newHeight would be negative.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(float newWidth)
        Changes the total width of the BoundingBox. The bottom right corner will move; its x coordinate becoming topLeft.x + newWidth.
        Parameters:
        newWidth - the new total height of the BoundingBox.

      • setWidthCentered

        public void setWidthCentered(float newWidth)
                      throws MathException
        Changes the total width of the BoundingBox. Both the bottom right corner and top left corner will move; expanding and shrinking relative to the center of the Bounding Box.
        Parameters:
        newWidth - the new total width of the BoundingBox.
        Throws:
        MathException - if the newWidth is negative.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Vector2D position)
        Changes the position of the top left point of the BoundingBox. The bottom right position will move relative to the top left.
        Parameters:
        position - the new position of the top left corner.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(float x,
                        float y)
        Changes the position of the top left point of the BoundingBox. The bottom right position will move relative to the top left.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x coordinate of the top left corner.
        y - the new y coordinate of the top left corner.

      • getPosition

        public Vector2D getPosition()
        Returns the top left position as a Vector2D.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the top left position of this BoundingBox.

      • getPositionReference

        public Vector2D getPositionReference()
        Returns a reference to the top left position as a Vector2D. Warning: this may cause unexpected side effects if this reference is changed from multiple objects.
        Returns:
        a reference to the top left position of this BoundingBox.

      • getCenter

        public Vector2D getCenter()
        Returns a Vector2D representing the center of this BoundingBox. This is equal to this.getPosition().add(this.getWidthHeightVec().scale(0.5)).
        Returns:
        a new Vector2D representing the center position of this BoundingBox. Note that the origin of the BoundingBox is the top left; The center of the BoundingBox and the BoundingBox position are not equal.

      • move

        public void move(Vector2D movement)
        All points in the BoundingBox will move by the given Vector2D. The x and y components of the given Vector2D will be added to the position of this BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        movement - the direction and distance to move the BoundingBox.

      • move

        public void move(float x,
                 float y)
        All points in the BoundingBox will move by the given x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - the amount to add to the x coordinates.
        y - the amount to add to the y coordinates.

      • getTopLeft

        public Vector2D getTopLeft()
        Returns a new vector2D representing the top left point in the BoundingBox. Note that this is equal to calling this.getPosition().
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the top left position of the BoundingBox.

      • getTopRight

        public Vector2D getTopRight()
        Returns a new vector2D representing the top right point in the BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the top right position of the BoundingBox.

      • getBottomRight

        public Vector2D getBottomRight()
        Returns a new vector2D representing the bottom right point in the BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the bottom right position of the BoundingBox.

      • getBottomLeft

        public Vector2D getBottomLeft()
        Returns a new vector2D representing the bottom left point in the BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the bottom left position of the BoundingBox.

      • getWidthHeightVec

        public Vector2D getWidthHeightVec()
        Returns a new Vector2D representing the width and height of this BoundingBox as a single object. Note that this is relative to the BoundingBox's top left.
        Returns:
        a Vector2D containing the width and height of this BoundingBox.

      • getArea

        public float getArea()
        Calculates and returns the total area of this BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        width multiplied by height.

      • scale

        public BoundingBox scale(float scale)
        Multiplies the width and height by the given scale. The BoundingBox is scaled using the center as the origin.
        Parameters:
        scale - the value to scale the BoundingBox by.
        Returns:
        a reference to this BoundingBox.

      • distance

        public double distance(BoundingBox other)
        Calculates and returns the distance between the position of this BoundingBox and the position of the given BoundingBox.
        Parameters:
        other - the target BoundingBox
        Returns:
        the distance between this object and the target BoundingBox.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  java.awt.Color colour)
        Draws the outline of this BoundingBox to the given Graphics context. This can be used to paint the BoundingBox to a variety of javax.swing components. The outline will be drawn in the given colour object and will be 1 pixel in width.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context to draw the BoundingBox to.
        colour - the colour of the outline.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
